page.title: 20Room For Improvement?
page.content: There were many suggestions for improving life in the area. The most popular centred on traffic, transport, smells and derelict houses. Most wanted some easing of heavy traffic through Podington. Some even suggested closure except for access. Better public transport was a common plea. Many complained about the smells and the flies from the maggot farm. Most felt that the villages would benefit if derelict houses could be modernised and lived in. Many want building restrictions lifted so some smaller houses could be built for young families. Other suggestions were for better amenities such as mains gas, tennis courts, bowling green, pre- school facilities and a Sunday School and a revival of old crafts and customs, closure of maggot farm and Santa Pod.
